Topic.Title: good news on MMGW

Message.Msg: MMGW models are pretty good these days. Models from 1980 predicted the rises up to present fairly well. "So how smart is it to attack an issue which we cannot resolve alone" Resolving the truth is not the same thing as planning an action, is this misunderstanding on your part the reason you engage in climate change denial.

Topic.Title: good news on MMGW

Message.Msg: Yes the models are pretty good. Take randomly selected 100 year slices from the preindustrial period of the 1000 year reconstructions and add this 'noise' to the model. Do this for many slices to form an ensemble of realizations and many would show the flattening of the last 20 years despite the model prediction alone not flattening. There would also be many ensembles that produced excessive warming in the last 20 years. None of the ensembles would suppress the model results entirely over the 100 year industrial span. So No it is not plain and simple, only YOU are plain and simple.

Message.Title: PC Makers Turn To Google Chromebooks
Message.Msg: Google it. No wonder softie shills are panicking... Quoting: "Chromebooks are beginning to catch on in a big way. " .... "Want to write an "Office" document? Go right ahead and then save it in Google's cloud storage system. Or print it using Google's cloud printing system. Want to watch a movie on Netflix (NFLX_)? There's a Chrome app for that. And games. "With Windows 8 not generating much excitement, some of Microsoft's long-time partners are also exploring the idea of Chromebooks of their own. Like Lenovo, which last week announced a Chromebook marketed to school systems. Or, today's rumor that HP (HPQ_) is going to announce a nifty Chromebook of its own next month. "

Message.Title: Micro-soft
Message.Msg: Opportunity for Microsoft With the Internet of Things on the verge of becoming reality, Microsoft’s software business will see tremendous growth going forward. Its “Windows and Windows Live” division, which reported a 24% year-over-year increase in revenue in the most recent quarter, will grow by leaps and bounds, because no other operating system will have the ability to integrate hundreds of millions of devices apart from Windows. With the pervasive nature of Windows, which has become even stronger with Windows 8, Microsoft will be in a commanding position. The “Server & Tools” business should also register impressive growth, with networking being the backbone of the Internet of Things. SQL Server and System Center sales will contribute more to Microsoft’s overall revenue growth. The Bottom Line Windows 8 will succeed, and I feel it will help Microsoft regain its market share in the overall OS business, from desktop computing to mobile computing. Once that is done, Microsoft will be firing all cylinders in software.

Microsoft is late to the tablet game but the tablet game against Apple is just beginning.

Message.Title: Surface Storage Space more than enough
Message.Msg: The 64 GB Surface with Windows RT has approximately 45 GB storage available for user content. If you do run out of space on your Surface, there are several easy ways to expand your storage. Surface comes pre-loaded with the SkyDrive app allowing you to store up to 7 GB of content in the cloud for free. The device also includes a microSDXC card slot that can be used to store up to 64 GB of additional content to your device. If you do run out of space on your Surface, the following storage options are available: •USB flash drive or hard drive •microSD, microSDHC, or microSDXC memory card •Cloud storage using SkyDrive
